abstract: A type of activity that posts the provided content to the Messages app.
overview:
## Discussion

When using this service, you can provide [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSString] and [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSAttributedString] objects as data for the activity items. You may also specify [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSURL] objects whose contents use the `sms` scheme.

If the device has MMS or FaceTime enabled, you can provide [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage], and [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSURL] objects as data for the activity items.

To specify an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSData] object, you must implement the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivityItemSource] protocol, return the data object in [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivityItemSource/activityViewController(_:itemForActivityType:)], and return the data object’s UTI in [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivityItemSource/activityViewController(_:dataTypeIdentifierForActivityType:)].

source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/UIKit/UIActivity/ActivityType-swift.struct/message

# message

**Type Property**

A type of activity that posts the provided content to the Messages app.

## Declaration

```swift
static let message: UIActivity.ActivityType
```

## Discussion

When using this service, you can provide [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSString] and [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSAttributedString] objects as data for the activity items. You may also specify [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSURL] objects whose contents use the `sms` scheme.

If the device has MMS or FaceTime enabled, you can provide [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage], and [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSURL] objects as data for the activity items.

To specify an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSData] object, you must implement the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivityItemSource] protocol, return the data object in [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivityItemSource/activityViewController(_:itemForActivityType:)], and return the data object’s UTI in [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivityItemSource/activityViewController(_:dataTypeIdentifierForActivityType:)].

## Constants

- **addToHomeScreen**
- **addToReadingList**: A type of activity that adds the URL to Safari’s reading list.
- **airDrop**: A type of activity that makes the provided content available through AirDrop.
- **assignToContact**: A type of activity that assigns the image to a contact.
- **collaborationCopyLink**
- **collaborationInviteWithLink**
- **copyToPasteboard**: A type of activity that posts the provided content to the pasteboard.
- **mail**: A type of activity that posts the provided content to a new email message.
- **markupAsPDF**: A type of activity that marks up the provided content as a PDF file.
- **openInIBooks**: A type of activity that opens the content in iBooks.
- **postToFacebook**: A type of activity that posts the provided content to the user’s wall on Facebook.
- **postToFlickr**: A type of activity that posts the provided image to the user’s Flickr account.
- **postToTencentWeibo**: A type of activity that posts the provided content to the user’s Tencent Weibo feed.
- **postToTwitter**: A type of activity that posts the provided content to the user’s Twitter feed.
- **postToVimeo**: A type of activity that posts the provided video to the user’s Vimeo account.
